comment.body: Adding a link to http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/ usually gets several more peers.
The Way to Go has some installation notes: https://cloud.mail.ru/public/2a6Y/yPBWared5
D:

Do you see anything unusual in the sidebar if you open the hub sites?  Exceeding the storage for a hub blocks all updates for it, but ZeroMe doesn't notify about that because it's a different site.  For Blue Hub I had to set the size limit to 5GB because ZeroNet believed it had grown to 2GB (around 2000 times larger than its actual size).  I think @nofish might have made a slight change to the size calculation, because previously updating would reset the perceived size to the correct value, but that no longer works.
Someone was using port 53110 for testing a second ZeroNet server.  Could a custom port be worked into the URL parsing?
In Firefox, zero:// is working but http://zero is interpreted as a host name.  The test page shows "fail" for both unless I disable Noscript.  Something is wrong with its whitelist...
@Kaffie: okay, now I have "pass" with the pac and "fail" for zero://, but both are redirecting.  I misunderstood how the pac should work.
@Kaffie: well, zero:// works.  I can't find anything that suggests why Noscript would block the iframe.
I've seen this too, but my profile looks okay now.
1424 now
@Another: do you really want to include that IP address?
@KaffieID Demo: seems okay
@Xubuntu KaffieID: did you want the other ID?
@nofish: sequential IDs don't seem to be a good way to index posts.  This is the fourth I've seen that was overwritten.
@ks: ulrichard wrote two posts with the same sequence number, so the first was overwritten but kept its comments.
There's a good mission report when you put a Kerbal into permanent orbit.
So erkan is squatting on all those names, and nobody can contact him? :/
@Sirenyc: the quota for ZeroTube is tiny... 10k.  You might be able to contact @lola through ZeroMail.
@nofish: the quota error message is really confusing.
@Kaffie: @waterrabbit's music player javascript could be an alternative to webtorrent if someone would make a site with sensible upload capacity.
I just remembered that's a name for something I've seen.  Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko?  <3 futon-chan.
What stopped working when you left it out?
They show a lot of real software being used correctly.  The main story is a little implausible, but otherwise the show is very well made.

@Durand: it gets difficult if you try to use code generation tools.  You might want a particular code fragment to be automatically included, but Python requires you to know the indentation level of the surrounding code every time, even if the code is never intended to be viewed by humans.  And I would disagree that Python is easier to read.  C has delimiters.

@Durand: every natural language publisher has a style guide as well.  That doesn't point to an inherent poor readability, but to the importance of consistency.  If nobody in a large project shared writing conventions, it would become an ugly mess.

Choosing a consensus time seems like a difficult problem.  Two issues:
* each user's publish time should only increase
* every peer should record an accurate time when they learn directly that content was published... but the time is set by the publisher
